[[Image:Gene Deitch.jpg|thumb|Gene Deitch]]
'''Gene Deitch''' ([[8 August]], [[1924]] â€“ [[16 April]], [[2020]]), was an American Academy Award-winning animator. Mainly known for his work on the Popeye and Tom and Jerry series, he was the director and creator of the [[The Hobbit (1967 film)|first animated film]] of ''[[The Hobbit]]'' in 1967. The film was produced by William Snyder and was made in under a month. The running time for the film was a minuscule 12 minutes and was produced simply so Snyder could extend his license for ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', and sell it back to [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] and his publishers for $100,000.
